titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Robert R. Livingston Papers
1707-1862
MS 388
titlestmt.author: Elise Winks

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-04-12 14:17:43 -0400.

did.abstract:
Papers and correspondence of Robert R. Livingston and other members of the Livingston family. Robert R. Livingston's correspondence deals with family matters; negotiations in Paris for the Louisiana Purchase; travel in Europe; his import of merino sheep to his estate in Clermont, N.Y.; and his business relations with Robert Fulton in the steamboat navigation of the Hudson River. There is also a large body of correspondence of his distant cousin, Walter Livingston, containing some letters and accounts related to his activities as Deputy Commissary General during the Revolutionary War as well as the settlement of the estate of his father, Robert Livingston, and his own business activities.
To request this material for research, and for fuller information about it, please follow this link to the record in N-YHS's catalog, Bobcat: Robert R. Livingston papers
did.langmaterial: The documents in the collection are in English.
